metadata.name: Aminophylline Hydrate 25mg ml Solution for Injection
metadata.composition: Each 10ml of solution contains aminophylline hydrate B P 250mg For the full list of

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Aminophylline is a complex of theophylline and ethylenediamine and is given for its theophylline activity to relax smooth muscle and to relieve bronchial spasm Aminophylline Injection is indicated for relief of bronchospasm associated with asthma and in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

contraindications.disease: Hypersensitivity to the ethylenediamine or those allergic to the theophyllines caffeine or theobromine or to any of the excipients listed in section 6 1 Aminophylline should not be administered concomitantly with other xanthine drugs When therapeutic doses of Aminophylline and or theophylline are administered simultaneously by more than one route or in more than one preparation the hazard of serious toxicity is increased The use of Aminophylline IV in children under 6 months of age is not generally recommended The use of Aminophylline is contra indicated in patients with acute porphyria
contraindications.excipients: Ethylenediamine Hydrate B.P.;Water for Injections B.P.
contraindications.incompatibilities: Incompatibility has been reported with chlorpromazine, clindamycin, corticotrophin, dimenhydrinate, doxorubicin, erythromycin gluceptate, hydralazine hydrochloride, hydroxyzine hydrochloride, opioid analgesics, oxytetracycline hydrochloride, phenytoin sodium, procaine hydrochloride, prochlorperazine salts, promazine hydrochloride, promethazine hydrochloride, sulphafurazole diethanolamine and vancomycin hydrochloride.
